elements.title: Cavalcade of the American Negro (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1940 poster for Cavalcade of the American Negro (pictured) anticipated 1960s Black Power iconography?

elements.title: Marcela Revollo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Marcela Revollo's pragmatic approach to legislating led her to cooperate with both neoliberal and socialist governments on women's rights legislation?

elements.title: All Saints' Episcopal Church (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that All Saints' Episcopal Church contains the crypt of its founder, Episcopal Bishop of Texas George Herbert Kinsolving?

elements.title: Nakhichevan uezd (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Nakhichevan uezd was home to more than 54,000 Armenians until they perished through the events of 1918–1920 as a result of the Russian Revolution?

elements.title: Sai Ying Pun (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the inspiration for the Hong Kong novel Sai Ying Pun came from the author oversleeping on a train?

elements.title: Tyrone Davis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Tyrone Davis set a school record with 28 career touchdown receptions while playing wide receiver for the Virginia Cavaliers?

elements.title: Grimethorpe Hall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the abandoned 17th-century Grimethorpe Hall in South Yorkshire, England, has been proposed as a potential new headquarters for the Grimethorpe Colliery Band?

elements.title: Gian Piero Ventrone (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that athletic trainer Gian Piero Ventrone, nicknamed "marine" for his very hard and tiring training sessions, made his players ring a "bell of shame" when they were too exhausted to continue?
